frontend.view_functions module¶

These are essential helper functions for the upload, analysis and profile views.

frontend.view_functions.get_analyses_array()¶

Returns an array of object, so we can display in a popover the parameters of each analysis on the profile page.

frontend.view_functions.get_form(form, files)¶

Merges files and form values of request, because flask separates them.

frontend.view_functions.get_studies_array()¶

Returns an array of object, so we can display in a popover the files of each study on the profile page.

frontend.view_functions.get_study_folder(study_id)¶

Returns a path to the current user’s study

frontend.view_functions.get_user_folder()¶

Returns the folder of the current user, based on the config params.

frontend.view_functions.save_analysis(form, study_id)¶

Creates analysis folder, calls save_analysis_to_db and write_params_file

frontend.view_functions.save_analysis_to_db(form, study_id)¶

Saves parameters of analysis and start it on the cluster

frontend.view_functions.save_study(form, files)¶

Creates study folder, saves uploaded files, checks their formatting

frontend.view_functions.save_study_to_db(files_dict, form)¶

Saves the paths of files and parameters to the db

frontend.view_functions.security_check(user_id, study_id, analysis=False)¶

For a couple of views, we need to make sure that the user is accessing content that is his/her and not others.

frontend.view_functions.write_params_file(folders, form, study_id)¶

Writes the params.csv file which is essential for each analysis to run.

frontend.views module¶

frontend.views.about()¶
frontend.views.all_exception_error(exception)¶
frontend.views.analysis(user_id, study_id)¶

Handles the setup of analyses. Just as upload, it uses AJAX POST requests to do the server side form validation.

frontend.views.delete_analysis(user_id, analysis_id)¶
frontend.views.delete_study(user_id, study_id)¶
frontend.views.forbidden_error(error)¶
frontend.views.get_file(user_id, study_id, analysis, file)¶

We need to serve static files (.js, .json) securely for the dashboard and visualisations that are not in the default location (i.e. static folder), because they are protected and user specific. app.instance_path was set to /userData with its absolute path in __init__.py.

If analysis is True, study_id will be checked as analysis_id.

frontend.views.help()¶
frontend.views.index()¶
frontend.views.internal_error(error)¶
frontend.views.not_found_error(error)¶
frontend.views.profile()¶
frontend.views.something_wrong(page)¶
frontend.views.static_from_root()¶
frontend.views.tc()¶
frontend.views.too_large_file()¶
frontend.views.upload()¶

Handles the upload of files. Uses AJAX POST requests to do server side form validation, which looks like client site validation.

frontend.views.vis(user_id, analysis_id, data_file)¶

Displays network visualisation for analysis
